hints_html:
What will be the (minimal) number of entries in the vector Xn and what will be the size of the matrix A?

The vector Xn must contain xn+2, xn+1 and xn, which suggest that Xn has length 3, and that hence A is a 3\(\times\)3 matrix.

To get to three equations we can always add trivial equations such as xn+2 = xn+2.

question: 5 (a)
sols_html:
As suggested in the hint we first add two trivial equations to help us rewrite the recursion relation in matrix form:

\[\begin{aligned} {7} x_{n+3} &&\; = \;&& x_{n+2} &&\; + \;&& x_{n+1} &&\; + \;&& x_n & \\ x_{n+2} &&\; = \;&& x_{n+2} &&\; \;&& &&\; \;&& & \\ x_{n+1} &&\; = \;&& &&\; \;&& x_{n+1} &&\; \;&& &\end{aligned}\]

This can be written as:

\[\begin{aligned} \begin{bmatrix} x_{n+3}\\ x_{n+2}\\ x_{n+1} \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} 1 &1 &1 \\ 1& 0 &0 \\ 0& 1 &0 \end{bmatrix} \begin{bmatrix} x_{n+2}\\ x_{n+1}\\ x_{n} \end{bmatrix}\end{aligned}\]

So define \(A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 &1 &1 \\ 1 & 1 &0 \\ 0 & 0 &0 \end{bmatrix}\) and \(X_{n} = \begin{bmatrix} x_{n+2}\\ x_{n+1}\\ x_{n} \end{bmatrix}\). Plugging in n = 0 we see that the initial vector X0 contains the initial conditions

\[\begin{aligned} X_{0} = \begin{bmatrix} c\\ b\\ a \end{bmatrix}.\end{aligned}\]
statement_html:
Define a sequence x0, x1, ... by the initial conditions x0 = a, x1 = b and x2 = c together with the recursion relation

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle x_{n+3} = x_{n+2} + x_{n+1} + x_n\end{aligned}\]

for n = 0, 1, 2, ...

(a) Rewrite this recursion in matrix form Xn+1 = AXn for n = 0, 1, 2, ... for a sequence Xn of vectors, with an initial vector X0 and some matrix A.
